intro: Chenopodium glaucum f. paschale, commonly known as the Paschal goosefoot, is a flowering plant species native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a bluish-green coloration on the upper surface and a lighter, often whitish underside. Its small, greenish flowers are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences called cymes. This plant is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes cultivated as a vegetable in some parts of the world.
